articles.title: GRAINS-Soybeans edge up as investors eye U.S. jobs report
articles.description: (Updates with European trading, changes byline/dateline)By Gus Trompiz and Matthew ChyePARIS/SINGAPORE, Feb 3 (Reuters) - Chicago soybean futures ticked up on Friday, staying on course for a weekly gain as participants assessed crop weather in drought-hit Argentina while awaiting U.S. jobs data for a latest gauge of the economic outlook.Wheat eased after a one-month peak a day

articles.title: “It Will Stay for Life” - France’s FIFA WC Star Divulges on His Last-Min Missed Chance Against Lionel Messi’s Argentina
articles.description: France’s star revealed his regret for missing a last-minute opportunity against Argentina which led to Lionel Messi lifting his first FIFA WC.
articles.content:
Published 02/03/2023, 6:00 AM EST

articles.title: Argentina’s Enzo Fernandez is ecstatic to have joined Chelsea, says ‘I will give my everything to achieve the club’s goals’
articles.description: Premier League side Chelsea announced the signing of Enzo Fernandez from Benfica on Wednesday after a day of complex negotiations between the clubs as the Argentina midfielder.
articles.content:

articles.title: Lionel Messi Clarifies Argetina Retirement, Opens Up on Playing 2026 FIFA World Cup
articles.description: After hoisting his first World Cup trophy with Argentina in December, Lionel Messi said that tournament would be his last, but now it appears he's open to the possibility of playing in the 2026 event
articles.content:
Lionel Messi inspired Argentina to their third World Cup trophy, his first, after beating France in the final at Qatar 2022 back in December.

articles.title: Lionel Messi open to playing in 2026 World Cup
articles.description: "Because of age it'll be difficult to make 2026," Messi, 35, told Diario Ole, a sports newspaper in Argentina.
articles.content:

articles.title: Messi has doubts about playing 2026 World Cup at age 39
articles.description: Lionel Messi may be in doubt as to whether he’ll be still playing for Argentina at the 2026 World Cup but he’s sure about one thing: he wants Lionel Scaloni to stay on as head coach until then, regardless.
articles.content:
The Associated Press
BUENOS AIRES (AP) — Lionel Messi may be in doubt as to whether he’ll be still playing for Argentina at the 2026 World Cup but he’s sure about one thing: he wants Lionel Scaloni to stay on as head coach until then, regardless.

articles.title: GRAINS-Soybeans set for weekly gain on Argentine drought concerns
articles.description: SINGAPORE, Feb 3 (Reuters) - Chicago soybean futures edged lower in early Asian trading on Friday, but were poised for weekly gains supported by uncertainty over supply from top producer Argentina amid dry weather conditions.Wheat and corn also fell, extending losses to a second consecutive session.FUNDAMENTALS* The most-active soybean contract on the Chicago Board of Trade
articles.content:
SINGAPORE, Feb 3 (Reuters) - Chicago soybean futures edged lower in early Asian trading on Friday, but were poised for weekly gains supported by uncertainty over supply from top producer Argentina amid dry weather conditions.
